channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Overhanging branches banging on passing bises, 16th July
item.description:
Overhanging tree branches are bashing on every passing bus, creating by serious noise (especially at night) and disturbing sleeping children, and possibly damaging buses

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Whitepost Lane, Ladywell, London

item.title: Hole in road, 16th July
item.description:
After returning from a weeks holiday I noticed a hole in the road that appears to be hollow inside. It is only relatively small at the moment but looks like it could potentially collapse in on itself. The hole was not there before went away last week so I don’t know when or how it developed. It needs to be investigated to ensure it’s not a potential sinkhole risk.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 43, Elcot Avenue, Peckham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street signs covered, 16th July
item.description:
Street/parking signs are covered with bin bags, has been like this for several weeks at least

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Vince Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter all over Finsbury Park Rd, 16th July
item.description:
On Finsbury Park Rd, from Seven Sisters all the way down to Mountgrove, there is litter EVERYWHERE. This may have been aggravated by the Wireless Festival held at Finsbury Park over the past weekend, but is also a consistent issue. This needs a fix now.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Finsbury Park Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipped rubbish Cranwood St, 16th July
item.description:
Rubbish since yesterday at least, the amount has increased. This is a regular flytipping spot, needs enforcement/planting etc to prevent in future

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): City Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Someone has dumped two black bin bags of rubbish on Plum Lane., 16th July
item.description:
Two black bin bags were dumped on Plum Lane outside an unoccupied property (No.75) about a day or two ago. The bags are now open and rubbish is flying out into the street and neighbouring properties.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Plum Lane, Shooters Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Light not working, 16th July
item.description:
This light has not been working for around 8 months. it is the first light by the corner of the telephone exchange on the left, by the green box on the street. It makes the properties very dark in the winter, when walking in and out towards the borders.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Footbury Hill Road, Goddington, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 4 overflorwing bins in square by Theydon Road dr surgery, 16th July
item.description:
These bins have not been emptied in over 3 weeks. Rubbish is piling up next to bins including dog excrement. The smell is awful.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Theydon Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Abandoned vehicle, no plates, obstruction to sheltered housing, 16th July
item.description:
Abandoned vehicle, number plates removed. Inside full of rubbish / parts so clearly abandoned. Parked incorrectly on Granite Street (not in a car space) and causing obstruction to entrance to sheltered housing at Butter Lodge. Requires removal asap

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Granite Street, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet
